perturbation.original_text:
WGT will permit Distributor and end-users purchasing
through resellers to return any defective Product in accordance with the
limited warranty contained in the applicable end-user license agreement or
limited hardware warranty, as applicable, provided that the Distributor and
end-user have compiled with the applicable warranty terms and conditions.
perturbation.changed_text: WGT may, at its discretion, permit Distributor and end-users purchasing through resellers to return any defective Product. The terms and conditions for any such return will be determined solely by WGT.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the legally required consumer right to return defective products under warranty, making it subject to WGT's discretion. The original clause refers to a 'limited warranty' implying some warranty exists, but this is weakened. This violates consumer protection laws within the European Union which require distributors to accept returns of defective goods under warranty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: EU Consumer Rights Directive (Directive 2011/83/EU) Article 16 - specifically relating to warranty rights for defective products.

perturbation.original_text:
Any amount not paid when due will be subject to finance charges
at the rate of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month or the maximum
rate permitted by applicable law; whichever is less, determined and
compounded on a daily basis from the date due until the date paid. Payment
of such finance charges will not excuse or cure Distributor's breach or
default for late payment. If WGT retains a collection agency, attorney or
other person or entity to collect overdue payments, all collection costs,
including but not limited to reasonable attorney's fees, will be payable by
Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: Any amount not paid when due will be subject to finance charges. If WGT retains a collection agency, attorney or other person or entity to collect overdue payments, collection costs may be payable by Distributor.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the specific interest rate (or the legally capped rate) and weakens the obligation to pay collection costs. The original clause sets a cap on interest rates (1.5% or maximum legal). Removing this violates usury laws. Removing 'including but not limited to reasonable attorneys' fees' weakens the obligation of the distributor and is very ambiguos, which might be contradicted with the European Laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Usury laws, Consumer Credit Regulations within the European Union.

perturbation.original_text:
WGT will defend and indemnify Distributor against any
judicial proceeding based upon infringement of any U.S. patent or US.
copyright by the Product to the extent that such proceeding arises from or
in connection with a component of the Product manufactured or developed by
WGT and not any third party, provided that Distributor notifies WGT of such
proceeding promptly after Distributor receives notice thereof, WGT has
control over the defense and settlement of the proceeding, Distributor
provides such assistance in the defense and settlement of the proceeding as
WGT may reasonably request, and Distributor complies with any settlement or
court order made in connection with such proceeding (e.g., as to the future
use of any infringing Product). WGT's obligations under this paragraph will
not apply to any infringement to the extent arising out of any use or
combination of the Product with any other products, goods, services or
other items furnished by Distributor or anyone other than WGT or to any
modification or change of the Product not made by WGT.
perturbation.changed_text: WGT may, at its discretion, defend and indemnify Distributor against any judicial proceeding based upon infringement of any U.S. patent or US. copyright by the Product. WGT's obligations under this paragraph will not apply to any infringement.
perturbation.explanation: This change transforms a mandatory indemnification into a discretionary one and greatly restricts that indemnification. The original clause offers indemnification under specific conditions. Removing the mandatory nature and limiting the scope to exclude 'any infringement' effectively nullifies the protection, potentially violating EU laws regarding product liability and distributor protection where WGT is responsible for the product design.
perturbation.contradicted_law: EU Directive on Product Liability (85/374/EEC), national laws implementing this directive across EU member states.
